content.description: This is a fun route for those lacking enough endurance to grab jugs for 70' on the main wall. I think I counted 9 moves before the climbing eases off and meanders to the single bolt anchor, but every one of those moves counts. Some of the clip positions are tricky or strenuous, and some holds near the 3rd bolt may be a tad friable, so belayers be warned.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a single bolt anchor
content.location: Look for a handful of climbs starting on a precarious pile of start stones left of the main wall and the prominent Maurice's Arete. This is the short climb that branches left on the small left arete.

content.description: Mega pumpy, fun climbing with some smaller holds and spicier moves up high. Some of the best rock quality in the canyon.
content.location: Left side of the main wall, immediately right of a small steep dihedral splitting the wall. The route climbs through the left side of a large hueco that would be right at home in the Red River Gorge.

content.description: Climb some steep overhanging terrain on good holds up to a long clip from an undercling. (Up to here is about 11a and a good warm up for Grace Falls as you clip two perma-draws you can lower from). Turn on your thinking cap and attack a boulder problem to the anchor (single bolt).
Start on rock pile, and mount start. Boulder through first two bolts using series of side pulls and edges before it eases up at the seam. Keep it together to the top.
content.location: Right of X, and just left of arete

content.description: Climb right-facing corner on a little suspect rock. Long pulls on steep stone to the anchors.
Steep endurance jug hauling. Even if the top is a bit wet the necessary holds may be dry...
content.location: Second route from the right, just right of the aptly named Spongebob.

content.description: Same line as Dogleg but instead of treading left continue straight up past last chain through the weakness.
At last bolt of Gel God, move left off sloper and good pocket to jugs on Troubadour.
content.location: Left side of main wall. Right of Troubadour. Look for long, yellow sling.

content.description: Jug hauling to a nice rest before the difficulty kicks in. Finishes with a big move.
content.location: Shares first bolt of Breakdown and moves left through 2 perma-draws. There is a left branch higher up that goes at 12c.

content.description: Classic jug hauling on moderately overhanging terrain. Rare to have a canyon climb where it gets its grade for the pump, do it.
content.location: One Bolt Line Left of Troubadour.

content.description: This climb would be 12+ without the two huge rest. Each shelve is guarded by a little spice. Rest up for the business guarding the chains. Guidebook says more than one 30+ ft whippers have been witnessed while trying to clip the chains.
content.location: This route is directly one bolt line left of Grace.

content.description: A fun, steep juggy wall with climbs predominantly in the 5.12 Range. Troubadour (12b) and Grace (12a) are not to be missed. On the left side are some short bouldery routes for your friends with no endurance. The approach can be wet and a bit sketchy, and the main wall tends to seep quite a bit, so save this crag for a time when the area has had a good dry spell.
